title: Ship & Boat Modelling Principles & Techniques
description: Comprehensive test on ship modelling history, tools, techniques, joints, and competition criteria

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of ship modelling in NCC training?

options.b: To develop observation skills and apply scientific knowledge
options.c: To learn ship building for career

questions.explanation: Ship modelling makes cadets observant, cool-headed and helps apply scientific knowledge while being an important part of naval training.

questions.text: Which ancient civilizations are known for early ship model discoveries?
questions.explanation: Ancient ship models have been discovered throughout Mediterranean, especially from ancient Greece, Egypt and Phoenicia.

questions.text: What are the two main views provided in ship modelling construction charts?
questions.explanation: Construction charts comprise Top View (Plan) for length/breadth and Side View (Elevation) for length/height/thickness measurements.

questions.text: Which type of wood is considered most suitable for ship modelling?
questions.explanation: Balsa is the most perfectly suited wood for modelling, especially if the model is designed to take its characteristics into account.

questions.text: What is the essential requirement for adhesives used in ship modelling?
questions.explanation: The first essential requirement for ship modelling adhesives is insolubility in water, making them waterproof.

questions.text: Which joint is commonly used for connecting wood pieces at right angles?
questions.explanation: Mortice and tenon joints are strong joints used for connecting pieces at right angles in ship modelling.

questions.text: What are the three main types of models built in NCC competitions?

options.c: Camp Model, Dte. Model, and VIP Model

questions.explanation: The three types are Camp Model (made during camp), Dte. Model (preparatory), and VIP Model (solid models).

questions.text: Which tool is used for making curved cuts in wood?
questions.explanation: Fret saw is used for making curved cuts and intricate designs in ship modelling work.

questions.text: What is the purpose of testing a model's stability during construction?

options.b: To ensure it floats correctly at waterline

questions.explanation: Testing stability ensures the hull floats true at the marked waterline and corrects trim before final assembly.

questions.text: Which adhesive is recommended for high-adhesion joints like metal to wood?
questions.explanation: Epoxy resins like Araldite provide extremely high adhesion for difficult materials but are relatively expensive.

questions.text: What is a 'Solid Model' in ship modelling?

options.a: Model made from single wood piece

questions.explanation: Solid model is made with solid block of wood including appendages attached post preparation of basic structure.

questions.text: Which tool is essential for holding workpieces securely during modelling?
questions.explanation: Bench vice is essential for holding workpieces securely during cutting, shaping, and assembly operations.

questions.text: What characteristic makes Balsa wood particularly suitable for modelling?

options.d: Dark color that doesn't need painting

questions.explanation: Balsa is lightweight and easy to cut and shape, making it ideal for modelling, though it requires sealing against water absorption.

questions.text: In competition judging, what does 'Proximity to drawing' refer to?
questions.explanation: 'Proximity to drawing' assesses how accurately the model follows the construction plans and specifications.

questions.text: What is the purpose of using ballast in ship models?

options.b: To correct trim and achieve proper waterline

questions.explanation: Ballast is used to bring the model down to its marks and correct trim, placed as low as possible in the hull.

questions.text: Which type of saw is specifically designed for cutting joints?
questions.explanation: Tenon saw is designed for precision cutting required in joint-making for ship modelling.

questions.text: What precaution is necessary when using power tools for ship modelling?

options.a: Using polythene dust covers when not in use

questions.explanation: Power tools should be covered with polythene/canvas dust covers when not in use to protect against dust and moisture.

questions.text: What does 'Righting Moment' refer to in model evaluation?

options.b: Ability to return to upright position when heeled

questions.explanation: Righting Moment assesses the model's stability and ability to return to upright position when tilted.

questions.text: Which tool is used for smoothing and shaping wood surfaces?
questions.explanation: Planes like jack plane and smoothing plane are used for smoothing and shaping wood surfaces in ship modelling.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of using full-sized plans in ship modelling?
questions.explanation: Full-sized plans minimize chances of error since errors get multiplied when enlarging from small scale plans.

questions.text: Which type of model is typically built during camps within specified time?
questions.explanation: Camp Models are made during a particular camp within specified period, usually power models.

questions.text: What is the primary use of a 'Spoke shave' in ship modelling?
questions.explanation: Spoke shave is used for shaping curved surfaces and intricate contours in ship modelling work.

questions.text: Why should wood for modelling not be kiln-dried?

options.b: It doesn't produce same result as natural seasoning

questions.explanation: Kiln-dried wood doesn't produce the same modelling results as natural seasoning and may have different working properties.

questions.text: What is evaluated in the 'Straight Run' performance test?
questions.explanation: Straight Run tests model's ability to maintain straight course, with marks deducted for deviation from center line.

questions.text: Which tool category includes items like tape measure and tri-square?
questions.explanation: Measuring and Testing Tools include tape, chain measure, foot rule, tri-square, sliding level, marking gauge and compass.
